Sun.title: Watch SpaceX launch 5,000 pounds of cargo to the ISS early on Aug. 24
Sun.description: The CRS-33 resupply flight for NASA is scheduled to lift off Sunday (Aug. 24) at 2:45 a.m. ET.
Sun.author: Elizabeth Howell

Sun.title: What time is SpaceX's Starship Flight 10 launch on Aug. 24?
Sun.description: SpaceX aims to launch its Starship Flight 10 test mission no earlier than Sunday at 7:30 p.m. EDT (2330 GMT), if conditions allow.
Sun.author: Tariq Malik

Sun.title: SpaceX moves giant Super Heavy rocket to pad ahead of Starship Flight 10 launch (photos)
Sun.description: Liftoff of Flight 10 is scheduled for Sunday evening (Aug. 24).
Sun.author: Mike Wall

Mercury.title: Look for Mercury in the morning sky as it hits peak distance from the sun on Aug. 19
Mercury.description: Mercury is farthest from the sun in Earth's morning sky on Aug. 19.
Mercury.author: Anthony Wood

Mercury.title: Don't miss Mercury, the moon and the Beehive Cluster align in a special August morning sky show
Mercury.description: A rare August morning alignment brings Mercury, a thin crescent moon and the Beehive Cluster together in the predawn sky. Here's how you can see it for yourself.
Mercury.author: Joe Rao

Mercury.title: How Much Has Mercury Shrunk?
Mercury.description: Mercury is still shrinking as it cools in the aftermath of its formation; new research narrows down estimates of just how much it has contracted.
Mercury.author: Sarah Stanley

Venus.title: Reining in the sun: Venus, Earth and Jupiter may work together to reduce the risk of extreme solar storms
Venus.description: "We consider this phenomenon as a promising candidate to explain the fact that the solar activity is much more benign than that of other sun-like stars."
Venus.author: Sharmila Kuthunur

Venus.title: See a razor-thin crescent moon join Jupiter and Venus in the predawn sky on Aug. 20
Venus.description: See the waning crescent moon rendezvous with Jupiter and Venus in the eastern sky on Aug. 20.
Venus.author: Anthony Wood

Venus.title: Venus reaches its highest point in the eastern predawn sky on Aug. 1: Here's how to see it
Venus.description: Venus reaches its highest altitude above the eastern horizon in 2025 on Aug. 1.
Venus.author: Anthony Wood

Earth.title: 'It's not over!' — Invasion' Season 3 clip carries an ominous warning from Trevante (exclusive)
Earth.description: Our heroic Navy SEAL gets interrogated years after the alien mothership plummets to Earth
Earth.author: Jeff Spry

Earth.title: Reining in the sun: Venus, Earth and Jupiter may work together to reduce the risk of extreme solar storms
Earth.description: "We consider this phenomenon as a promising candidate to explain the fact that the solar activity is much more benign than that of other sun-like stars."
Earth.author: Sharmila Kuthunur

Earth.title: Watch 2 fiery blasts erupt from the sun — is Earth in the danger zone? (video)
Earth.description: Two colossal plasma fountains tore away from the sun in a breathtaking double blast, one of the most impressive eruptions this solar cycle.
Earth.author: Daisy Dobrijevic

Mars.title: New moon of August 2025 brings a rare black moon and a close Mars encounter
Mars.description: A rare black moon darkens the sky on Aug. 23, 2025, followed by a close encounter between the young crescent and Mars just days later.
Mars.author: Jesse Emspak

Mars.title: Curiosity rover images 3 intersecting Mars ridges | Space photo of the day for Aug. 21, 2025
Mars.description: As part of its exploration of Mars's boxwork landscape, Curiosity found itself in a fork-in-the-road
Mars.author: Kenna Hughes-Castleberry

Mars.title: Acting NASA administrator Sean Duffy says the agency will 'move aside' from climate sciences to focus on exploring moon and Mars
Mars.description: The United States space agency has pioneered planetary science technologies as the world's leader in climate research for more than 40 years, but that may be about to change.
Mars.author: Josh Dinner

Jupiter.title: Jupiter quiz: Think you know about the Jovian gas giant?
Jupiter.description: This quiz will challenge your knowledge of Jupiter's features, moons, and the missions that have dared to get close.
Jupiter.author: Kenna Hughes-Castleberry

Jupiter.title: Reining in the sun: Venus, Earth and Jupiter may work together to reduce the risk of extreme solar storms
Jupiter.description: "We consider this phenomenon as a promising candidate to explain the fact that the solar activity is much more benign than that of other sun-like stars."
Jupiter.author: Sharmila Kuthunur

Jupiter.title: See a razor-thin crescent moon join Jupiter and Venus in the predawn sky on Aug. 20
Jupiter.description: See the waning crescent moon rendezvous with Jupiter and Venus in the eastern sky on Aug. 20.
Jupiter.author: Anthony Wood

Saturn.title: Titan darkens Saturn in rare shadow transit on Aug. 19: Here's how to see it
Saturn.description: The second largest moon in the solar system will cast its shadow over Saturn on Aug. 19.
Saturn.author: Anthony Wood

Saturn.title: Saturn's largest moon Titan casts a colossal shadow in breathtaking amateur portrait (photo)
Saturn.description: Efrain Morales captured the image of Titan's shadow darkening Saturn on July 18, while the gas giant was over 800 million miles from Earth.
Saturn.author: Anthony Wood

Saturn.title: New moon of July 2025 sees Saturn swim with the fishes tonight
Saturn.description: Saturn will be quite distinct in the Pisces constellation.
Saturn.author: Jesse Emspak

Uranus.title: Scientists find tiny new moon around Uranus with the James Webb Space Telescope (photos, video)
Uranus.description: The discovery brings the total number of known Uranian moons to 29.
Uranus.author: Brett Tingley

Uranus.title: Don't miss the moon rendezvous with the Pleiades in the early morning sky Aug. 16–17
Uranus.description: The moon will drift towards the Pleiades and Uranus in the early hours of Aug. 16-17.
Uranus.author: Anthony Wood

Uranus.title: Scientists find Uranus is surprisingly warm, heating up the case for a new planetary mission
Uranus.description: "I think it strengthens the case for a mission to Uranus."
Uranus.author: Brett Tingley

Neptune.title: Astronomers discover strange solar system body dancing in sync with Neptune: 'Like finding a hidden rhythm in a song'
Neptune.description: "This is a big step in understanding the outer solar system."
Neptune.author: Robert Lea

Neptune.title: Don't miss the moon pass close to Saturn and Neptune tonight
Neptune.description: The moon, Saturn and Neptune will rise a little before midnight for those in the U.S.
Neptune.author: Anthony Wood

Neptune.title: Venus is at its farthest from the sun on June 1: Here's how to see the bright 'morning star' this weekend
Neptune.description: Venus will rise in the eastern sky in the pre-dawn hours of June 1 alongside Saturn and Neptune.
Neptune.author: Anthony Wood
